entities.name: miss pennyfeather
entities.description: Professor Binns' colleague, mentioned as being present in the class.

entities.name: professor binns
entities.description: A professor at Hogwarts, known for his strict and dismissive attitude.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The former headmaster of Hogwarts, mentioned as an example by Professor Binns.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: A co-founder of Hogwarts, mentioned in the context of a myth about his building a secret broom cupboard.

entities.name: dean thomas
entities.description: A student at Hogwarts, who tries to contribute to the discussion but is cut off by Professor Binns.

entities.name: ron weasley
entities.description: Harry's friend and classmate, who shares his thoughts about Salazar Slytherin with Harry and Hermione.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main protagonist of the story, mentioned as being present in the conversation with Ron and Hermione.

entities.name: hermione granger
entities.description: Harry's friend and classmate, who is part of the conversation about Salazar Slytherin.

relationships.description: Professor Binns uses Dumbledore as an example to illustrate his point.
Professor Binns is discussing a myth about Slytherin building a secret broom cupboard.
Ron shares his opinion that Salazar Slytherin was a 'twisted old loony'.
